title: P&G Investors, Heirs Pressure Bounty Maker Over Deforestation
sub_head: Environmental groups push protest vote against board director; Procter & Gamble says its sourcing from Canadian woodlands is sustainable
body:
Environmentalists scored a win against a corporate giant last year when Procter & Gamble Co. shareholders backed a proposal asking the maker of Charmin toilet paper and Bounty paper towel to report on its efforts to address deforestation.
This year, the Natural Resources Defense Council, Sierra Club and several dozen descendants of P&Gâ€™s founding families are lobbying shareholders to vote against longtime director Angela Braly.
